document_title: Pancreatitis: Causes, signs, complications, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Most people with acute or chronic pancreatitis have the following symptoms:
1. Symptoms of acute pancreatitis
Pain that starts slowly or suddenly in the upper abdomen, may spread to the back; The pain can last several days (1); Fever; Nausea; Vomiting; Distention; Fast heart beat
2. Symptoms of chronic pancreatitis
Pain in the upper abdomen, often occurring after eating, can spread to the back; Diarrhea; Nausea; Vomiting; Weight loss; Fatty stools
Pancreatitis often has pain that starts slowly or suddenly in the upper abdomen
subsection_data:
